# List of King's College, Hong Kong alumni

The following is a list of notable alumni from King's College, Hong Kong.
1930s
*Chung Sze-yuen ()  – Hong Kong mechanical engineer, industrialist, business executive and politician
*D. C. Lau () – prominent sinologist; author of the widely read translations of Tao Te Ching, Mencius and The Analects; contributed to the Proper Cantonese pronunciation movement
*George Ho ()  – Hong Kong media mogul; fifth son of influential Hong Kong businessman Robert Hotung
*Harry Fang ()   – Hong Kong orthopaedic surgeon; legislator and campaigner who promoted rehabilitation services; widely known as the "father of rehabilitation" in Asia
*James Wu Man-hon () – former chairman of the Federation of Hong Kong Industries
*Ma Lin () – Vice-Chancellor of the Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK) from 1978 to 1987; founder of Shaw College, the fourth constituent college of CUHK
*Simon Li ()  – Hong Kong senior judge and politician
*Stanley Kwan Shih-kuang ()  – Hong Kong banker who created the internationally known Hang Seng Index in 1969
1940s
*Chiu Hin-kwong ()  – former member of the Executive Council and Legislative Council of Hong Kong
1950s
*Harnam Singh Grewal ()  – career civil servant of Hong Kong; former Secretary for the Civil Service in the Government of Hong Kong
*Hui Ki On ()  – the last Commissioner of the Royal Hong Kong Police from 1994 to 1997; the first Commissioner of Hong Kong Police from 1 July 1997 to 1 January 2001
*Hui Yin-fat ()  – member of the Legislative Council of Hong Kong (1991—1995) for Social Services; member of the Executive Council in 1991; member of the Provisional Legislative Council; director of Hong Kong Council of Social Service from 1973 to 2001
*Li Kwan Ha () – the first ethnic Chinese to serve as the Commissioner of the Royal Hong Kong Police in Hong Kong
1960s
*Cheung Kwok Che () – member of the Legislative Council of Hong Kong (Functional constituency, Social Welfare)
*Ching W. Tang () – American physical chemist; awarded the Wolf Prize in Chemistry
*David Chan Yuk-cheung () – prominent leader of the Baodiao movement in Hong Kong
*Deborah Chung () – American scientist and author
*Hui Chiu-yin ()  – director and general manager of New World First Ferry in Hong Kong; former Chief Superintendent of Marine Regional in Hong Kong Police Force
*Inez Fung () – professor of atmospheric science at the University of California, Berkeley
*Lam Chiu Ying ()  – Hong Kong meteorologist; bird-watcher; conservationist and blogger; director of the Hong Kong observatory from 2003 through 2009; honorary fellow of the Royal Meteorological Society; Honorary University Fellow of the University of Hong Kong; honorary president of the Hong Kong Bird Watching Society
*Law Chi-kwong ()  – Hong Kong politician; associate professor in social work at the University of Hong Kong
*Leung Chun Ying ()  – third and incumbent Chief Executive of the Executive Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region
*Patrick Lau Lai-chiu () – former career civil servant in the Hong Kong Government; retired in 2007 as Director of Lands, head of the Lands Department
*Raymond Or ()  – Vice-chairman of G-Resources Group; Vice-chairman and chief executive officer of China Strategic Group; chairman of Esprit Holdings
1970s
*Ceajer Chan Ka-keung () SBS, JP, Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury in the Government of Hong Kong
*Johnson Lam Man-hon (), Vice President of the Court of Appeal of the High Court (Hong Kong)
1980s
*Wilson Shieh (), Hong Kong artist
1990s
*Laura Cozijnsen (), Founder of Lighthouse Consultant Limited; Communications Coach; King's girl
